description: Export the contents of a plot to a file. Can create hardcopy images, convert to different file formats, or create data files to recreate the plot. If no plot name is specified, the current view is assumed. Default filename is 'flac3d_name' where 'name' is the plot name.

keywords.name: s
keywords.description: Plot name. If not specified, the current view is assumed.

keywords.name: bitmap
keywords.description: Render plot to a bitmap file. Supports PNG (default), BMP, PPM, XBM, XPM formats. Sub-keywords: dpi <i> (dots per inch), dpm <i> (dots per meter), filename <s> (output file, extension determines format), size <ix> <iy> (bitmap size in pixels, default 1024x768).

keywords.name: csv
keywords.description: Create CSV text file with data from plot items that support conversion (e.g., charts, tables). Can be imported into spreadsheet programs. Default extension is CSV.

keywords.name: datafile
keywords.description: Export a data file that can recreate the plot when read with the program call command. Default extension is F3DAT.

keywords.name: dxf
keywords.description: Export geometric contents as DXF file. Note: DXF format does not support all plot features, results may differ from screen. Default extension is DXF.

keywords.name: pdf
keywords.description: Create PDF file. Sub-keywords: filename <s>, landscape (default portrait), margin <fx1 fx2 fy1 fy2> <inches|millimeters> (default 0.25in), paper <fx fy> <inches|millimeters> (default 11x8.5in), size <ix iy> (bitmap size for 3D rendering).

keywords.name: postscript
keywords.description: Create Postscript file. Sub-keywords: filename <s>, landscape (default portrait), margin <fx1 fx2 fy1 fy2> <inches|millimeters> (default 0.25in), paper <fx fy> <inches|millimeters> (default 11x8.5in), size <ix iy> (bitmap size for 3D rendering). Default extension is PS.

keywords.name: print
keywords.description: Send plot to operating system print system. Opens print dialog in interactive mode, or sends to default printer when running from data file.

keywords.name: svg
keywords.description: Generate Scalable Vector Graphics file. Sub-keywords: filename <s> (default extension SVG), size <ix iy> (bitmap portion size in pixels).

examples.description: Export current plot to PNG file
Export plot 'myplot' to PDF in landscape orientation
Export plot as SVG vector graphics
Export plot data to CSV file
Export plot as high-resolution 300 DPI PNG

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('plot export bitmap filename <path>') - no direct Python SDK method
